name: Barnsley FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
1887.

	Reverend Tiverton Preedy formed the club which was named Barnsley St. Peters, but was renamed to Barnsley in 1897.

questions.text: Who was Barnsley's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Fairclough.

	Fairclough had three spells as the clubs manager. The first of these was 1898-1901. Between 1901-04, McCartney took the hot seat, and Fairclough came back in 1904 for another 8 years. His last spell was between 1928-30.

questions.text: Who did Barnsley beat in the 1912 FA Cup final?
questions.explanation:
West Bromwich Albion.

	Barnsley and West Brom drew 0-0 in the final, but at the toss of a coin chose the replay to be staged at Bramall Lane, Sheffield, where they won 1-0.

questions.text: Which team did Barnsley beat 9-0 and, at that time, set a record for their highest league win?
questions.explanation:
Loughborough Town.

	The game took place on January 28, 1899, in a Division Two match.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most goals for Barnsley?
questions.explanation:
Ernest Hine.

	Ernest Hine scored 123 goals for Barnsley between 1921-38.

questions.text: How many times did Barnsley win the Division Three (North) title?
questions.explanation:
3.

	They won the Division Three (North) title in 1933-34, 1938-39 and 1954-55.

questions.text: What happened to Barnsley in the 1996-97 season?
options: The club had six managers in one season
questions.explanation:
Promoted to the Premier League.

	Barnsley were promoted in second place with 80 points alongside champions Bolton Wanderers, who had 98, and play-off winners Crystal Palace, who finished in 6th, and were promoted when they beat Sheffield United in the final at Wembley Stadium, London.

questions.text: Were Barnsley relegated in the 2001-02 season?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Barnsley were relegated in 23rd place out of 24 in Division One, along with Crewe Alexandra and Stockport County.

questions.text: Where did the club sign Bruce Dyer from?
questions.explanation:
Crystal Palace.

	Bruce Dyer was signed from Crystal Palace in October, 1998. He started his professional career with Watford.

questions.text: During the 1997-98 season, Barnsley had it tough with heavy defeats, including two 6-0 losses and one 7-0 defeat. Who beat them 7-0?
questions.explanation:
Manchester United.

	The game took place on October 25, 1997. Manchester United were 4-0 up at half-time, with Andy Cole scoring a first-half hat-trick.
